briefdescription.para: buffer for exceptions raised in threads
pointers to connection parameters specified as arrays
dictionaries to pass to connect function, one per thread for every syn_spec
indicate that weight and delay should not be set per synapse
indicate that weight should not be set per synapse
indicate that delay should not be set per synapse
all other parameters, mapping name to value representation
synapse-specific parameters that should be skipped when we set default synapse parameters

detaileddescription.para: Connect sources to targets according to specifications in dictionary.
where conn_spec_dict speficies connection type and its parameters.
Now we can connect with or without structural plasticity
Now we can delete synapses with or without structural plasticity

memberdef.argsstring: (NodeCollectionPTR, NodeCollectionPTR, const DictionaryDatum &, const std::vector< DictionaryDatum > &)
memberdef.name: ConnBuilder

detaileddescription.para: Updates the number of connected synaptic elements in the target and the source. Returns 0 if the target is either on another MPI machine or another thread. Returns 1 otherwise.

parameterdescription.para: amount of connected synaptic elements to update

briefdescription.para: Return true if rule is applicable only to nodes with proxies.

memberdef.argsstring: (index snode_id, Node &target, thread target_thread, RngPtr rng, index indx)
memberdef.name: update_param_dict_

briefdescription.para: Create connection between given nodes, fill parameter values.

detaileddescription.para: Calls value-function of all parameters being instantiations of ArrayDoubleParameter or ArrayIntegerParameter, thus moving the pointer to the next parameter value. The function is called when the target node is not located on the current thread or MPI-process and read of an array.
Returns true if conventional looping over targets is indicated.

Conventional looping over targets must be used if
any connection parameter requires skipping
targets are not given as a simple range (lookup otherwise too slow)

Conventional looping should be used if
the number of targets is smaller than the number of local nodes
For background, see Ippen et al (2017).

simplesect.para: true if conventional looping is to be used

detaileddescription.para: Collects all array parameters in a vector.
If the inserted parameter is an array it will be added to a vector of ConnParameters. This vector will be exploited in some connection routines to ensuring thread-safety.
The base class extracts and holds parameters and provides the connect interface. Derived classes implement the connect method.

simplesect.para: Naming classes *Builder to avoid name confusion with Connector classes.
